DOC.brief_title: Functional Surface Electromyogram Knee Extensors Healthy Humans Patients With Patella-dislocation .
DOC.detailed_description: Introduction The kneecap dislocate due accident also due interior turn stretch knee joint slide bearing . E. Arendt ( Arendt 2002 ) write overview work , possible cause work method patella dislocation discuss . Despite almost one hundred quotation author able find cause possible treatment concept . The study examine healthy adult ( 25 female 25 men ) 25 patient patella dislocation routine apply clinical gait analysis surface EMG ( European SENIAM guideline ) Laboratory Gait Analysis Basel Children 's University Hospital Basel . The combination gait analysis surface EMG Wavelet analysis may objectify possible reason patella dislocation compare intensity pattern EMG group . Method All subject ( healthy patient patella dislocation ) prior study inform study sign consent The investigation include follow task : - Preparation subject clinical gait analysis place reflect marker low body accord maker setup Davis et al . ( Davis III et al. , 1991 . - Preparation subject surface EMG muscle : gastrocnemius medialis , tibialis anterior , vastus medialis , vastus lateralis , rectus femoris , biceps femoris , semitendinosus accord SENIAM-Standard . - Measurements : 10 trial level walk self select speed 3 time 5 single leg quads force plate . - System : VICON 460 ( 6 Cameras , 120 Hz , Oxford Metrics Ltd. , UK ) . - EMG-System : Zebris , Tuebingen , Germany ; Amplifiers : Biovision , Wehrheim , Germany , EMG-Electrodes : Bipolar Ag/AgCl Surface Electrodes Noraxon , Sampling rate : 2520 Hz - Data analysis : Kinetic-and kinematic data Vicon-Software , EMG-Data Wavelet Package ( Biomechanigg , Calgary , Canada ) - Statistical Analysis : ANVOA
DOC.criteria: Patient : Patella Dislocation surgery Control : healthy Patient : Patella Dislocation able walk , Patient : use orthosis crutch Control : knee injury ( e.g . ACLrupture ) Control : leg surgery last 5 year Control : sport injury last 6 month ( e.g . Muscle pull )
